name: dwc-dp
title: Darwin Core Data Package
description: A data package for sharing biodiversity data using Darwin Core.

tableSchemas.name: agent
tableSchemas.title: Agent
tableSchemas.description: A resource that acts or has the power to act.
tableSchemas.comments: A person, group, organization, machine, software or other entity that can act. Membership in the dcterms:Agent class is determined by the capacity to act, even if not doing so in a specific context. To act: To participate in an event or process by contributing through behavior, operation, or an effect resulting from active participation — regardless of whether that contribution is intentional, volitional, or conscious.
tableSchemas.examples: `Carl Linnaeus`; `The Terra Nova Expedition`; `The National Science Foundation`; `The El Yunque National Forest ARBIMON System`; `ChatGPT`
tableSchemas.rdfs:comment: A resource that acts or has the power to act.

tableSchemas.name: agent-agent-role
tableSchemas.title: Agent Agent Role
tableSchemas.description: A role filled by a dcterms:Agent with respect to another dcterms:Agent.
tableSchemas.examples: `an instance of a dcterms:Agent that is a person is the director of another instance of a dcterms:Agent that is an organization`; `an instance of a dcterms:Agent that is a person is a member of another instance of a dcterms:Agent that is a group`; `an instance of a dcterms:Agent that is a person is the author of another instance of a dcterms:Agent that is software`

tableSchemas.name: agent-identifier
tableSchemas.title: Agent Identifier
tableSchemas.description: An adms:Identifier for a dcterms:Agent.
tableSchemas.comments: An important point to note is that properties of the adms:Identifier class are properties of the Identifier, not the resource that it identifies or the agency that issued it.
tableSchemas.examples: `an ORCID`; `a Wikidata Q-number`; `an Index Herbariorum Institution Code`; `an International Standard Name Identifier`
tableSchemas.rdfs:comment: In RDF this is expressed using the adms:Identifier class with the following properties: 1) the content string should be provided using skos:notation, datatyped with the identifier scheme (including the version number if appropriate); 2) use dcterms:creator to link to a class describing the agency that manages the identifier scheme or adms:schemaAgency to provide the name as a literal.

tableSchemas.name: agent-media
tableSchemas.title: Agent Media
tableSchemas.description: A dcterms:Agent as content in a dwc:Media entity.
tableSchemas.examples: `a person shown in a photograph`; `a group of people in a video`

tableSchemas.name: bibliographic-resource
tableSchemas.title: Bibliographic Resource
tableSchemas.description: A book, article, or other documentary resource.
tableSchemas.rdfs:comment: A book, article, or other documentary resource.

tableSchemas.name: chronometric-age
tableSchemas.title: Chronometric Age
tableSchemas.description: An approximation of temporal position (in the sense conveyed by https://www.w3.org/TR/owl-time/#time:TemporalPosition) that is supported by evidence.
tableSchemas.comments: The age of a dwc:MaterialEntity and how this age is known, whether by a dating assay, a relative association with dated material, or legacy collections information.
tableSchemas.examples: `An age range associated with a specimen derived from an AMS dating assay applied to an oyster shell in the same stratum`; `An age range associated with a specimen derived from a ceramics analysis based on other materials found in the same stratum`; `A maximum age associated with a specimen derived from K-Ar dating applied to a proximal volcanic tuff found stratigraphically below the specimen`; `An age range of a specimen based on its biostratigraphic context`; `An age of a specimen based on what is reported in legacy collections data.`
tableSchemas.rdfs:comment: An approximation of temporal position (in the sense conveyed by https://www.w3.org/TR/owl-time/#time:TemporalPosition) that is supported by evidence.

tableSchemas.name: chronometric-age-agent-role
tableSchemas.title: Chronometric Age Agent Role
tableSchemas.description: A role filled by a dcterms:Agent with respect to a chrono:ChronometricAge.

tableSchemas.name: chronometric-age-assertion
tableSchemas.title: Chronometric Age Assertion
tableSchemas.description: A dwc:Assertion made by a dcterms:Agent about a chrono:ChronometricAge.
tableSchemas.rdfs:comment: A measurement of or fact about an rdfs:Resource (http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#Resource).

tableSchemas.name: chronometric-age-media
tableSchemas.title: Chronometric Age Media
tableSchemas.description: A chrono:ChronometricAge as content in a dwc:Media entity.

tableSchemas.name: chronometric-age-protocol
tableSchemas.title: Chronometric Age Protocol
tableSchemas.description: A dwc:Protocol used for a chrono:ChronometricAge.

tableSchemas.name: chronometric-age-reference
tableSchemas.title: Chronometric Age Reference
tableSchemas.description: A dcterms:BibliographicResource related to a chrono:ChronometricAge.

tableSchemas.name: event
tableSchemas.title: Event
tableSchemas.description: An action, process, or set of circumstances occurring at a dcterms:Location during a period of time.
tableSchemas.examples: `a material collecting event`; `a bird observation`; `a camera trap image capture`; `an organism occurrence`; `a biotic survey`
tableSchemas.rdfs:comment: An action that occurs at some location during some time.

tableSchemas.name: event-agent-role
tableSchemas.title: Event Agent Role
tableSchemas.description: A role filled by a dcterms:Agent with respect to a dwc:Event.

tableSchemas.name: event-assertion
tableSchemas.title: Event Assertion
tableSchemas.description: A dwc:Assertion made by a dcterms:Agent about a dwc:Event.
tableSchemas.rdfs:comment: A measurement of or fact about an rdfs:Resource (http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#Resource).

tableSchemas.name: event-identifier
tableSchemas.title: Event Identifier
tableSchemas.description: An adms:Identifier for a dwc:Event.
tableSchemas.comments: An important point to note is that properties of the adms:Identifier class are properties of the Identifier, not the resource that it identifies or the agency that issued it.
tableSchemas.rdfs:comment: In RDF this is expressed using the adms:Identifier class with the following properties: 1) the content string should be provided using skos:notation, datatyped with the identifier scheme (including the version number if appropriate); 2) use dcterms:creator to link to a class describing the agency that manages the identifier scheme or adms:schemaAgency to provide the name as a literal.

tableSchemas.name: event-media
tableSchemas.title: Event Media
tableSchemas.description: A dwc:Event as content in a dwc:Media entity.

tableSchemas.name: event-protocol
tableSchemas.title: Event Protocol
tableSchemas.description: A dwc:Protocol used for a dwc:Event.

tableSchemas.name: event-provenance
tableSchemas.title: Event Provenance
tableSchemas.description: A dwc:Provenance for a dwc:Event.

tableSchemas.name: event-reference
tableSchemas.title: Event Reference
tableSchemas.description: A dcterms:BibliographicResource related to a dwc:Event.

tableSchemas.name: geological-context
tableSchemas.title: Geological Context
tableSchemas.description: A set of geological designations, such as stratigraphy, that qualifies a dcterms:Location.
tableSchemas.examples: `a particular lithostratigraphic layer`; `a specific chronostratigraphic unit`
tableSchemas.rdfs:comment: Geological information, such as stratigraphy, that qualifies a region or place.

tableSchemas.name: geological-context-media
tableSchemas.title: Geological Context Media
tableSchemas.description: A dwc:GeologicalContext as content in a dwc:Media entity.

tableSchemas.name: identification
tableSchemas.title: Identification
tableSchemas.description: A classification of a resource according to a classification scheme.
tableSchemas.comments: For biology, the assignment of a scientific name or taxon concept to a dwc:Organism.
tableSchemas.examples: `a subspecies determination of an organism`; `a nomenclatural act designating a specimen as a holotype`
tableSchemas.rdfs:comment: A taxonomic determination (e.g., the assignment to a dwc:Taxon).

tableSchemas.name: identification-agent-role
tableSchemas.title: Identification Agent Role
tableSchemas.description: A role filled by a dcterms:Agent with respect to a dwc:Identification.

tableSchemas.name: identification-reference
tableSchemas.title: Identification Reference
tableSchemas.description: A dcterms:BibliographicResource related to a dwc:Event.

tableSchemas.name: identification-taxon
tableSchemas.title: Identification Taxon
tableSchemas.description: A construct of components and positions of dwc:Taxa in a dwc:Identification.

tableSchemas.name: material
tableSchemas.title: Material
tableSchemas.description: An entity that can be identified, exist for some period of time, and consist in whole or in part of physical matter while it exists.
tableSchemas.comments: The term is defined at the most general level to admit descriptions of any subtype of material entity within the scope of Darwin Core. In particular, any kind of material sample, preserved specimen, fossil, or exemplar from living collections is intended to be subsumed under this term.
tableSchemas.examples: `the entire contents of a trawl`; `a subset of the contents of a trawl`; `the body of a fish`; `the stomach contents of a fish`; `a rock containing fossils`; `a fossil within a rock`; `an herbarium sheet with its attached plant specimen`; `a flower on a plant specimen`; `a pollen grain`; `a specific water sample`; `an isolated molecule of DNA`
tableSchemas.rdfs:comment: An entity that can be identified, exists for some period of time, and consists in whole or in part of physical matter while it exists.

tableSchemas.name: material-agent-role
tableSchemas.title: Material Agent Role
tableSchemas.description: A role filled by a dcterms:Agent with respect to a dwc:MaterialEntity.

tableSchemas.name: material-assertion
tableSchemas.title: Material Assertion
tableSchemas.description: A dwc:Assertion made by a dcterms:Agent about a dwc:MaterialEntity.
tableSchemas.rdfs:comment: A measurement of or fact about an rdfs:Resource (http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#Resource).

tableSchemas.name: material-geological-context
tableSchemas.title: Material Geological Context
tableSchemas.description: A dwc:GeologicalContext from which a dwc:MaterialEntify was derived.
tableSchemas.comments: Use this table to establish one or more GeologicalContexts represented in a dwc:MaterialEntity.

tableSchemas.name: material-identifier
tableSchemas.title: Material Identifier
tableSchemas.description: An adms:Identifier for a dwc:MaterialEntity.
tableSchemas.comments: An important point to note is that properties of the adms:Identifier class are properties of the Identifier, not the resource that it identifies or the agency that issued it.
tableSchemas.rdfs:comment: In RDF this is expressed using the adms:Identifier class with the following properties: 1) the content string should be provided using skos:notation, datatyped with the identifier scheme (including the version number if appropriate); 2) use dcterms:creator to link to a class describing the agency that manages the identifier scheme or adms:schemaAgency to provide the name as a literal.

tableSchemas.name: material-media
tableSchemas.title: Material Media
tableSchemas.description: A dwc:MaterialEntity as content in a dwc:Media entity.

tableSchemas.name: material-protocol
tableSchemas.title: Material Protocol
tableSchemas.description: A dwc:Protocol used for a dwc:MaterialEntity.

tableSchemas.name: material-provenance
tableSchemas.title: Material Provenance
tableSchemas.description: A dwc:Provenance for a dwc:MaterialEntity.

tableSchemas.name: material-reference
tableSchemas.title: Material Reference
tableSchemas.description: A dcterms:BibliographicResource relatd to a dwc:MaterialEntity.

tableSchemas.name: material-usage-policy
tableSchemas.title: Material Usage Policy
tableSchemas.description: Rights, usage, and attribution statements applicable to dwc:MaterialEntity.

tableSchemas.name: media
tableSchemas.title: Media
tableSchemas.description: A dcmi:MediaType or other media type with other entities as subject matter.
tableSchemas.comments: An instance of digital textual media may be better represented as a dcterms:BibliographicResource.
tableSchemas.rdfs:comment: A dcmi:MediaType or other media type with other entities as content.

tableSchemas.name: media-agent-role
tableSchemas.title: Media Agent Role
tableSchemas.description: A role filled by a dcterms:Agent with respect to a dwc:Media entity.

tableSchemas.name: media-assertion
tableSchemas.title: Media Assertion
tableSchemas.description: A dwc:Assertion made by a dcterms:Agent about a dwc:Media entity.
tableSchemas.rdfs:comment: A measurement of or fact about an rdfs:Resource (http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#Resource).

tableSchemas.name: media-identifier
tableSchemas.title: Media Identifier
tableSchemas.description: An adms:Identifier for a dwc:Media entity.
tableSchemas.comments: An important point to note is that properties of the adms:Identifier class are properties of the Identifier, not the resource that it identifies or the agency that issued it.
tableSchemas.rdfs:comment: In RDF this is expressed using the adms:Identifier class with the following properties: 1) the content string should be provided using skos:notation, datatyped with the identifier scheme (including the version number if appropriate); 2) use dcterms:creator to link to a class describing the agency that manages the identifier scheme or adms:schemaAgency to provide the name as a literal.

tableSchemas.name: media-provenance
tableSchemas.title: Media Provenance
tableSchemas.description: A dwc:Provenance for a dwc:Media entity.

tableSchemas.name: media-usage-policy
tableSchemas.title: Media Usage Policy
tableSchemas.description: Rights, usage, and attribution statements applicable to dwc:Media entity.

tableSchemas.name: molecular-protocol
tableSchemas.title: Molecular Protocol
tableSchemas.description: A protocol used to derive and identify a dwc:NucleotideSequence from a dwc:MaterialEntity.
tableSchemas.examples: `a standard DNA barcoding workflow using Sanger sequencing`; `a shotgun metagenomics pipeline for microbial community profiling`; `a high-throughput amplicon sequencing protocol targeting 16S rRNA`
tableSchemas.rdfs:comment: A protocol used to derive and identify a nucleotide sequence from a dwc:MaterialEntity.

tableSchemas.name: molecular-protocol-agent-role
tableSchemas.title: Molecular Protocol Agent Role
tableSchemas.description: A role filled by a dcterms:Agent with respect to a dwc:MolecularProtocol.

tableSchemas.name: molecular-protocol-assertion
tableSchemas.title: Molecular Protocol Assertion
tableSchemas.description: A dwc:Assertion made by a dcterms:Agent about a dwc:MolecularProtocol.
tableSchemas.rdfs:comment: A measurement of or fact about an rdfs:Resource (http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#Resource).

tableSchemas.name: molecular-protocol-reference
tableSchemas.title: Molecular Protocol Reference
tableSchemas.description: A dcterms:BibliographicResource related to a dwc:MolecularProtocol.

tableSchemas.name: nucleotide-analysis
tableSchemas.title: Nucleotide Analysis
tableSchemas.description: A link between a dwc:NucleotideSequence and a dwc:Event and a dwc:MaterialEntity from which it was derived, using a specified dwc:Protocol.
tableSchemas.rdfs:comment: A link between a dwc:NucleotideSequence and a dwc:Event and a dwc:MaterialEntity from which it was derived, using a specified dwc:Protocol.

tableSchemas.name: nucleotide-analysis-assertion
tableSchemas.title: Nucleotide Analysis Assertion
tableSchemas.description: A dwc:Assertion made by a dcterms:Agent about a dwc:NucleotideSequence.
tableSchemas.rdfs:comment: A measurement of or fact about an rdfs:Resource (http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#Resource).

tableSchemas.name: nucleotide-sequence
tableSchemas.title: Nucleotide Sequence
tableSchemas.description: A digital representation of a nucleotide sequence.
tableSchemas.rdfs:comment: A digital representation of a nucleotide sequence.

tableSchemas.name: occurrence
tableSchemas.title: Occurrence
tableSchemas.description: A state of a dwc:Organism in a dwc:Event.
tableSchemas.examples: `a wolf pack on the shore of Kluane Lake in 1988`; `a virus in a plant leaf in the New York Botanical Garden at 15:29 on 2014-10-23`; `a fungus in Central Park in the summer of 1929`
tableSchemas.rdfs:comment: An existence of a dwc:Organism at a particular place at a particular time.

tableSchemas.name: occurrence-agent-role
tableSchemas.title: Occurrence Agent Role
tableSchemas.description: A role filled by a dcterms:Agent with respect to a dwc:Occurrence.

tableSchemas.name: occurrence-assertion
tableSchemas.title: Occurrence Assertion
tableSchemas.description: A dwc:Assertion made by a dcterms:Agent about a dwc:Occurrence.
tableSchemas.rdfs:comment: A measurement of or fact about an rdfs:Resource (http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#Resource).

tableSchemas.name: occurrence-identifier
tableSchemas.title: Occurrence Identifier
tableSchemas.description: An adms:Identifier for a dwc:Occurrence.
tableSchemas.comments: An important point to note is that properties of the adms:Identifier class are properties of the Identifier, not the resource that it identifies or the agency that issued it.
tableSchemas.rdfs:comment: In RDF this is expressed using the adms:Identifier class with the following properties: 1) the content string should be provided using skos:notation, datatyped with the identifier scheme (including the version number if appropriate); 2) use dcterms:creator to link to a class describing the agency that manages the identifier scheme or adms:schemaAgency to provide the name as a literal.

tableSchemas.name: occurrence-media
tableSchemas.title: Occurrence Media
tableSchemas.description: A dwc:Occurrence as content in a dwc:Media entity.

tableSchemas.name: occurrence-protocol
tableSchemas.title: Occurrence Protocol
tableSchemas.description: A dwc:Protocol used for a dwc:Occurrence.

tableSchemas.name: occurrence-reference
tableSchemas.title: Occurrence Reference
tableSchemas.description: A dcterms:BibliographicResource related to a dwc:Occurrence.

tableSchemas.name: organism
tableSchemas.title: Organism
tableSchemas.description: A particular organism or defined group of organisms considered to be taxonomically homogeneous.
tableSchemas.comments: Instances of the dwc:Organism class are intended to facilitate linking one or more dwc:Identification instances to one or more dwc:Occurrence instances. Therefore, things that are typically assigned scientific names (such as viruses, hybrids, and lichens) and aggregates whose dwc:Occurrences are typically recorded (such as packs, clones, and colonies) are included in the scope of this class.
tableSchemas.examples: `a specific bird`; `a specific wolf pack`; `a specific instance of a bacterial culture`
tableSchemas.rdfs:comment: A particular organism or defined group of organisms considered to be taxonomically homogeneous.

tableSchemas.name: organism-assertion
tableSchemas.title: Organism Assertion
tableSchemas.description: A dwc:Assertion made by a dcterms:Agent about a dwc:Organism.
tableSchemas.rdfs:comment: A measurement of or fact about an rdfs:Resource (http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#Resource).

tableSchemas.name: organism-identifier
tableSchemas.title: Organism Identifier
tableSchemas.description: An adms:Identifier for a dwc:Organism.
tableSchemas.comments: An important point to note is that properties of the adms:Identifier class are properties of the Identifier, not the resource that it identifies or the agency that issued it.
tableSchemas.rdfs:comment: In RDF this is expressed using the adms:Identifier class with the following properties: 1) the content string should be provided using skos:notation, datatyped with the identifier scheme (including the version number if appropriate); 2) use dcterms:creator to link to a class describing the agency that manages the identifier scheme or adms:schemaAgency to provide the name as a literal.

tableSchemas.name: organism-interaction
tableSchemas.title: Organism Interaction
tableSchemas.description: An interaction between two dwc:Organisms during a dwc:Event.
tableSchemas.comments: Supports only primary observed interactions, not habitual or derived taxon-level interactions. Pairwise interactions must be used to represent multi-organism interactions. When possible, typify the action rather than the state from which an action is inferred, with the actor as the subject dwc:Occurrence and the acted-upon as the related dwc:Occurrence. Only one direction of a two-way interaction is necessary, though both are permissible as distinct OrganismInteractions with distint subject dwc:Occurrences.
tableSchemas.examples: `a bee visiting a flower`; `a Mallophora ruficauda hunting an Apis mellifera in flight`; `a viral infection in a plant`; `a female spider mating with a male spider`; `a lion cub nursing from its mother`; `a mosquito sucking blood from a chimpanzee's arm`; `a slug eating a fungus growing on decomposing stump (2 interactions)`
tableSchemas.rdfs:comment: An interaction between two dwc:Organisms during a dwc:Event.

tableSchemas.name: organism-interaction-agent-role
tableSchemas.title: Organism Interaction Agent Role
tableSchemas.description: A role filled by a dcterms:Agent with respect to a dwc:OrganismInteraction.

tableSchemas.name: organism-interaction-assertion
tableSchemas.title: Organism Interaction Assertion
tableSchemas.description: A dwc:Assertion made by a dcterms:Agent about a dwc:OrganismInteraction.
tableSchemas.rdfs:comment: A measurement of or fact about an rdfs:Resource (http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#Resource).

tableSchemas.name: organism-interaction-media
tableSchemas.title: Organism Interaction Media
tableSchemas.description: A dwc:OrganismInteraction as content in a dwc:Media entity.

tableSchemas.name: organism-interaction-reference
tableSchemas.title: Organism Interaction Reference
tableSchemas.description: A dcterms:BibliographicResource related to a dwc:OrganismInteraction.

tableSchemas.name: organism-reference
tableSchemas.title: Organism Reference
tableSchemas.description: A dcterms:BibliographicResource related to a dwc:Organism.

tableSchemas.name: organism-relationship
tableSchemas.title: Organism Relationship
tableSchemas.description: A dwc:ResourceRelationship of one dwc:Organism to another dwc:Organism.
tableSchemas.comments: An OrganismRelationship must be a permanent relationship. Ephemeral relationships between dwc:Organisms should be recorded as dwc:OrganismInteractions.
tableSchemas.examples: `an instance of a dwc:Organism is the mother of another instance of a dwc:Organism`
tableSchemas.rdfs:comment: A relationship of one rdfs:Resource (http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#Resource) to another.

tableSchemas.name: protocol
tableSchemas.title: Protocol
tableSchemas.description: A method used during an action.
tableSchemas.examples: `a pitfall trap method for sampling ground-dwelling arthropods`; `a point-radius georeferencing method`; `a linear regression model to estimate body mass from skeletal measurements`; `a Bayesian phylogenetic inference method`
tableSchemas.rdfs:comment: A method used during an action.

tableSchemas.name: protocol-reference
tableSchemas.title: Protocol Reference
tableSchemas.description: A dcterms:BibliographicResource related to a dwc:Protocol.

tableSchemas.name: provenance
tableSchemas.title: Provenance
tableSchemas.description: Information about an entity’s origins.
tableSchemas.comments: This is a convenience class to group related properties.

tableSchemas.name: resource-relationship
tableSchemas.title: Resource Relationship
tableSchemas.description: A relationship of one rdfs:Resource (http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#Resource) to another.
tableSchemas.comments: Resources can be thought of as identifiable records or instances of classes and may include, but need not be limited to instances of dwc:Occurrence, dwc:Organism, dwc:MaterialEntity, dwc:Event, dcterms:Location, dwc:GeologicalContext, dwc:Identification, or dwc:Taxon.
tableSchemas.examples: `an instance of a dwc:Organism is the mother of another instance of a dwc:Organism`; `a uniquely identified dwc:Occurrence represents the same dwc:Occurrence as another uniquely identified dwc:Occurrence`; `a dwc:MaterialEntity is a subsample of another dwc:MaterialEntity`
tableSchemas.rdfs:comment: A relationship of one rdfs:Resource (http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#Resource) to another.

tableSchemas.name: survey
tableSchemas.title: Survey
tableSchemas.description: A biotic survey or inventory.
tableSchemas.comments: This class includes properties found in the Humboldt Extension to Darwin Core (eco: namespace), except for the target scope terms, which can be accommodated in eco:SurveyTarget.
tableSchemas.examples: `a botanical survey of a protected area to assess native and invasive plant species`; `a wetland vegetation mapping`; `a camera trap deployment in a rainforest to monitor large mammals`; `a frog call survey in wetlands across breeding seasons`; `a coverboard survey for reptiles in forested environments`; `a pollinator survey in an agricultural landscape`; `a macroinvertebrate sampling in a freshwater stream to assess water quality`; `a habitat- or ecosystem-level survey (e.g., coral reef health assessment, forest biodiversity assessment)`; `an environmental impact assessment (e.g., pre-construction biological baseline survey for a wind farm project)`
tableSchemas.rdfs:comment: A biotic survey or inventory.

tableSchemas.name: survey-agent-role
tableSchemas.title: Survey Agent Role
tableSchemas.description: A role filled by a dcterms:Agent with respect to an eco:Survey.

tableSchemas.name: survey-assertion
tableSchemas.title: Survey Assertion
tableSchemas.description: A dwc:Assertion made by a dcterms:Agent about an eco:Survey.
tableSchemas.rdfs:comment: A measurement of or fact about an rdfs:Resource (http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#Resource).

tableSchemas.name: survey-identifier
tableSchemas.title: Survey Identifier
tableSchemas.description: An adms:Identifier for an eco:Survey.
tableSchemas.comments: An important point to note is that properties of the adms:Identifier class are properties of the Identifier, not the resource that it identifies or the agency that issued it.
tableSchemas.rdfs:comment: In RDF this is expressed using the adms:Identifier class with the following properties: 1) the content string should be provided using skos:notation, datatyped with the identifier scheme (including the version number if appropriate); 2) use dcterms:creator to link to a class describing the agency that manages the identifier scheme or adms:schemaAgency to provide the name as a literal.

tableSchemas.name: survey-protocol
tableSchemas.title: Survey Protocol
tableSchemas.description: A dwc:Protocol used for an eco:Survey.

tableSchemas.name: survey-reference
tableSchemas.title: Survey Reference
tableSchemas.description: A dcterms:BibliographicResource related to a dwc:Survey.

tableSchemas.name: survey-target
tableSchemas.title: Survey Target
tableSchemas.description: A specification of characteristics of dwc:Occurrences that were included or excluded in an eco:Survey.
tableSchemas.examples: `include all bird species`; `include reproductive female Ctenomys sociabilis`; `include Oncorhynchus mykiss, include Oncorhynchus clarkii, exclude total length < 12 inches`
tableSchemas.rdfs:comment: A specification of a characteristics of dwc:Occurrences that were included or excluded in an eco:Survey.

tableSchemas.name: usage-policy
tableSchemas.title: Usage Policy
tableSchemas.description: Information about rights, usage, and attribution statements applicable to an entity.
tableSchemas.comments: This is a convenience class to group related properties.
tableSchemas.rdfs:comment: Rights and attribution statements applicable to an entity.
